bioghist.p: Clair Wilcox (1898-1970) was on the faculty of Swarthmore College from 1927 to 1968 and chaired the Department of Economics for 37 years. Professor Wilcox was a distinguished economist who authored six books and, perhaps most notably, chaired the International Trade Conference, which led to the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT), the predecessor of today's World Trade Organization (WTO).

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of memos and reports related to the negotiations for an international trade organization which led to the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade. The materials include drafts of tariff proposals and a draft of a trade agreement charter, preliminary and followup reports on the negotiations, and a copy of a memorandum from the Department of State to President Truman asking his approval for tariff cuts negotiated at the Geneva conference, along with dissents submitted by other government agencies. There is also a transcript of Wilcox's testimony to the State Department about the 1947 meeting in Geneva of the Committee for an International Conference on Trade and Employment and a copy of the official report of the U.S. Delegation to this meeting.
